identifier.value: Greater Boston Area Companies With Fewer Than 10 Employees (Top 10K)

news_insight_text_link.news_insight_description: Active Surfaces, a startup specializing in flexible solar panel technology, has successfully raised $5.6 million in an oversubscribed pre-seed funding round. This financial milestone will support the development of their lightweight, flexible solar panels that can be integrated into a variety of surfaces.

org_similarity_summary.insight_similar_orgs: Active Surfaces, Spor, Amriton, Luminescent Solar Power, TROES, and Andluca Technologies are involved in the renewable energy and solar technology sector. Spor and Andluca Technologies focus on personal power generation and smart window products, while Amriton specializes in water treatment technology. Luminescent Solar Power and TROES are dedicated to developing solar energy technology and smart power energy storage solutions, respectively.

overview_description.description: Active Surfaces is commercializing MIT-developed ultra-thin-film solar technology. The company seeks to revolutionize the conventional energy sector by making solar power widespread and seamlessly integrating it into everyday materials. Its innovative manufacturing approach significantly reduces production expenses, presenting a transformational opportunity for semiconductor and electronics manufacturing.

identifier.value: Shiv Bhakta Founder / Business Development @ Active Surfaces
Richard Swartwout Chief Technology Officer and Founder @ Active Surfaces

properties.growth_insight_description: Active Surfaces may be growing as it has successfully raised $5.6 million to develop its ultra-thin-film solar technology. This substantial funding indicates investor confidence and the availability of capital for research and development. Additionally, the financial support is specifically aimed at advancing their 'solar 2.0' technology, which suggests progress in product development and innovation within the renewable energy sector.

about_short_description.short_description: Active Surfaces offers ultra-thin-film solar technology that can be applied to any surface.

product.name: Ultra-Light Solar Modules
product.description: Thin solar modules that are lighter than a human hair, designed for a wide range of deployment opportunities.

product.name: Flexible Solar Technology
product.description: Solar technology that can be applied to virtually any surface, eliminating the need for rigid solar panels.

product.name: Low-Cost Solar Solutions
product.description: Solar technology with a low cost floor for both the module and installation, making it more affordable.
